Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Cindy E
Reviews.Content: Great "just off the strip" hotel. It is smoke free, drama free and casino free! Great roof top pool with nice work out room and super free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Away from the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Edfel
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but positive remarks on this hotel. It kept the high standards that Marriott customers are used to. The free continental breakfast was a bonus. It was, however, extremely busy as it is one of the favorite military billeting sites in the City of Las Vegas. It is in a quite area away from the Strip which we love and there was no gambling here. The free covered parking in the adjoining parking structure was so convenient for us. Service from the reception area to housekeeping was excellent. We had a Filipina housekeeper and she went out of her way to make sure we were comfortable in our Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Weekend”
Reviews.Author: suethestew
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite hotels in the US! I am a retired Flight Attendant and have stayed at many hotels through the years! The staff is very welcoming and the minute you walk into this hotel, you have a sense of peace and calm from the furnishings and smell of the hotel. It feels like you are walking into a spa! The complimentary breakfast buffet was very good! The rooftop pool and firepit are a bonus, Not crowded at all due to the fact you are not on the strip. Worth checking out if you are headed to Las Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Awesome staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: cathrine99
Reviews.Content: Came to las Vegas for a business. Super clean everything. Didn't realize it would look like that by seeing the outside of the hotel. Left my expensive electronics in the room and they mailed it to me!! How often does THAT happen ?!?! Would def stay again.... Wasn't right on the main strip but the walk wasn't that bad maybe 5-10 mins or an 8 dollar cab ride (if the cabbie doesnt take u on a detour)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: ADRTron
Reviews.Content: I must say it was nice to not have to navigate the typical casino maze to get to your room, along with the immediately evident lack of cacophony typical of such mazes. The whole place is very nice and clean with friendly employees. Free breakfast, WiFi, and parking are all great perks. Within (Vegas) walking distance of the CC. Fairly convenient to the monorail (Hilton or CC stations) and right on the SDX bus line that takes you downtown. Great place if you're just in town for a convention and have been there and done the whole "Vegas" thing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the strip”
Reviews.Author: Bub99
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice "non-Vegas" hotel so you can avoid some of the craziness if you want, but easy enough access to the strip to get your fix. Free breakfast was good, also nice to have a restaurant and room service available if you want it in the evening, something you don't always see in a SpringHill Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Beaten Track”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTooTravel
Reviews.Content: This place is great because there are no long line ups at the front desk. You are taken care of right away. The breakfast is a nice plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “SEMA was Awesome”
Reviews.Author: GummyStewart
Reviews.Content: We went to the SEMA show in November. There was so much to see it was almost overwhelming. The site was great easy to get around considering all the people. The thing I liked most about the location was you could catch the Mono Rail from the strip and be there in minutes. It is a short walk from the train to the site but easy. The show it self was great. Everything Automtive you could think of seemed to be there. If you are into vehicles the you should go. If you are not part of the auto industry you can still go and walk through the parking lots and see some of the most amazing vehicles ever. The show is put on every November. It is the Speacial Equipment Manufactures Association. It is well worth a visit .

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas Magic stay”
Reviews.Author: Leon F
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in a Springhill property and I was quite pleased. I liked the look of the room, its layout being a little different from most hotel rooms. I was there for the "Magic" show at the Convention center which is pretty much just across the street although its about a block to the main entrance. It was nice to be able to leave the show and go right to my room rather than to have a cab ride first. The room was clean & quiet as was the area outside. The decor is current and comfortable. The only thing I didn't care for was the coffee maker as it uses little disks to make individual cups of coffee and since I like strong coffee I tend to double up most hotel's coffee but it wouldn't work in this case. Not that big of a deal as there was free coffee to go on the breakfast buffet - not bad coffee at that. One hotel (not Springhill) I stayed at charged extra if you tried to take a coffee to go off the "free" breakfast buffet. The Springhill breakfast buffet was pretty good - the first morning of the show was quite hectic and the staff was having a hard time keeping up but if you waited a few moments you could get what you wanted. I also thought it closed rather early - I think it was supposed to be finished at 9:00 am but seemed to be open for a while after. I did have a couple of issues while I was there - the tv stopped working and the toilet developed a tiny leak . The staff said the tv was probably just the power cord as they commonly work loose when the tv is swiveled from the living room to the bed area. Unfortunately the toilet was a bigger job and I opted to change rooms which was cheerfully facilitated by the staff. I did not partake of the pool or other facilities. Of course this hotel has no casino but the LVH is across the street and the Riviera and the rest of the strip is just across a parking lot. Over all, I like the hotel and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suites, good place to stay off the strip”
Reviews.Author: whippetlovr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the SPringhill Suites for 3 days for work, and was very happy with the room with which I was provided. Linens and bedding is very comfortable, and the room is quite dark at night for sleeping. The small fridge, coffee maker and microwave were unexpected but definitely nice to have. Free internet was a definite bonus, and being able to work at the work station or wireless was nice. The room and bathroom and water closet were all clean. The buffet breakfast is actually a decent spread, with scrambled eggs, bacon, toast/bagels, waffle station, cereals, fruit etc. The front desk staff were very helpful in assisting us with taxis and advice on getting around. The one beef we had was in accessing the rooftop pool and fire pit. We were told repeatedly that they were 'cleaning the pool' so we couldn't access the roof. Lookign right out the door at the pool, the same red hose laid on the ground for days in a row... not being used. The pool was not being cleaned, nor filled. And even if it was, the fire pit area is separate from the pool. We had to go through quite the rigamarole of asking at least a half dozen workers to let us access the rooftop for some fresh air during our conference, and we didn't appreciate the snarky front desk woman claiming the pool was being cleaned or filled, depending on when we asked. Otherwise, a nice place to stay, though pricey if you don't get a deal on the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_WalnutCreek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located almost across the street from the convention center. It is not very close to The Strip (Las Vegas Blvd). It is not a typical Las Vegas hotel. It does not have a casino or a flashy lobby. My room was not large, but quite nice. There were two separate bathrooms. One with a shower and vanity and the other had the toilet and a small sink. The bed was very comfortable and there was a nice desk to work at. The 37” HD TV was also very nice. The free internet was good when it worked. It was non-working for almost 24 hours. The breakfast was your typical buffet with eggs, waffles, oatmeal, pastries, and cold cereal. The amenities are on the top floor (24th). The gym was pretty big, and the outdoor pool and spa provided a nice view of Vegas. The lobby bar serves an acceptable meal if you’re looking for the basics. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My number one hotel while in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: wkrupa
Reviews.Content: This to me has always been my favorite for the three to four times a year I get into Las Vegas for work. It is clean, it is fresh, and it fits my needs while conducting business in the city. It is well within walking distance of the strip and great restaurants, and you get a free breakfast to start your day. I'll keep my sleeping time while at Vegas right here each and every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: RioRebel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. Nice and clean. Friendly staff. No smoke, casinos, etc to deal with. Our room was very comfortable and quiet. We slept very well. The breakfast buffet was very good. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas peace and quiet...”
Reviews.Author: TxTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights for a meeting at the hotel. The rate was insane (140) because of multiple large conventions. I DO NOT like paying so much in Vegas... Especially for a limited service hotel. But supply and demand, you know... So, if you are stuck paying this much in a city that can be 29.00 a night, this is a good comfy place. Super clean, roomy, GREAT bed, powerful shower and a big flat screen. Wifi is free (thank God!) and personnel friendly. Can't ask for much more. The first night I ordered delivery from KungFu. It was awesome! I got the green papaya salad and a bowl of shrimp Tom yum. Great food, 45 minute delivery. A little pricey, but in Vegas just about all decent food is pricey. Here's the funny thing about this trip... For the first time, I took the city bus to a hotel. The 208 picks up from the 0 level at the airport. Simple, simple. 2.00 and it dropped off across the street from the hotel. The driver was nice and friendly. It's not so common that tourists take this bus and he chatted with me most of the way. There is some riff raff on the bus, but not dangerous or anything. There's a gas station next door and you can get drinks and stuff for pretty cheap. I felt pretty vulnerable walking in the area and the lady working in the gas station said that I should not walk alone at night in the area... Which felt pretty obvious in the daytime. I would stay here again, I really had a good quality sleep and shower, which is what I am out for, no matter where I am visiting!

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of peace and quiet in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LvsChagall
Reviews.Content: I'll start off by saying - I don't like Las Vegas - in fact, I pretty much hate it. Too loud, crude, rude, bright, crowded, expensive, traffic is hell.. ok, you get the picture. But I have to go there for work from time to time, usually for a convention or trade show. I am thrilled to death that my company found a hotel like the SpringHill Suites. You almost don't remember your in Vegas... and that was a good thing for me.. Front desk staff is VERY nice - not like the snooty people in the high-end Vegas hotels I have stayed in. Helpful, courteous - interested in speaking with you - who knew! Breakfast is included in room rate - very convenient - but certainly not a lot to write home about. Especially when I was there for a week - packaged baked goods were terrible, dry - old; just give us some bread and let us toast it.. Eggs were ok on some days - on some days tasteless and overcooked - meat alternates between canadian bacon: good healthy choice but always overcooked; turkey sausage: overcooked and not great. The "make your own waffles" are great, but I really can't eat those for 6 days in a row. A mix of cereals and hot oatmeal (overcooked and sitting in the pot for hours, can you say gelatinous?) Coffee, apple and orange juices (certainly from a cheap concentrate). The rooms are very nice. Well appointed, modern - well layed out - beds are very comfortable. nice desk area for working - the internet access should be easy, but service was spotty - they need to bring someone in to work on it. small fridge and microwave - one cup coffee maker but for heavens sake get rid of those 'service packs' that provide 1 pack of horrific powdered cream, 2 sugars and a napkin. Go downstairs and grab some half and half and sugar from the breakfast area and keep it in your fridge. Bar/restaurant only open 5-11, makes sense in this environment. Good service though- good pours on the wines by the glass. Pool and exercise room on top floor - very nice - and a fire pit - which was awesome - very nice touch. Definitely would stay here again - right across from convention center so very convenient and the best part: No casino or slot machines!!

Reviews.Title: “aaaaaaaaaaah away from the strip”
Reviews.Author: GRAVEBEAR
Reviews.Content: The room design will appeal to younger travelers (I like it) the blues and the greens was refreshing. After staying one night at the MGM it was refreshing. There are not a lot of immediate food options on Paradise, The mature staff where friendly and knowledgeable. The workout room and the pool is on the roof with a commanding view of the strip.Very good stay

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve 2011”
Reviews.Author: baron48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on New Years Eve 2011. Good location for a third the price of a place on the Strip. Very modern, spacious rooms, free parking, free internet, free breakfast, and friendly service make this a great place to stay and a refreshing change from the nickel and diming you typically get in Vegas. Would pick this over the Las Vegas Hilton (now LVH).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha_Blue20
Reviews.Content: I found out Vegas is not for me. I don't gamble nor drink, but this hotel is awesome. The front desk people are great (Linda, Lynn), Shannon (manager) is also wonderful. The room is clean, fresh and big. The separated shower and toilet is great. The breakfast is also great. It was a wonderful experience the three nights I spent here. I'd for sure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “l hate las vegas but......”
Reviews.Author: pickypatrick
Reviews.Content: went there for 6 nights for a wedding during the marathon of dec 4...45,00 runners and you could actually get married during...we had the duty of staying behind @ the encore/wynn to check on the post race wedding reception.. tough duty...the marriott is within walking distance if the weather is nice...it was freezing when we were there...parking at the wynn/encore is free so we drove ....back to the springhill suites...the rooms are very spacious for a 6 night stay which is why we chose it. great free breakfast with starbucks coffee...professional,friendly staff throughout...was concerned about a tripadvisor review re: bedbugs..got an email from gm who assured me the report was inaccurate.she even sent me an exterminators inspection of the room...what a response !!! would stay there anytime...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Candizz
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time at this hotel. They made our trip to vegas easy and comfortable. First off, friendly greetings. We got greeted everytime we walked in, even though they knew we had just left to pick up a few things at the AMPM next door. They were helpful in directing us to certain places and showed us directly on a map where to go. Buffet. It's always great to have a complimentary breakfast. But to have a complimentary HOT breakfast? it was great. We went in November, so the lines were not too long. Nothing to complain about and the food was decent. No complaints there, very satisfied with the food. The rooms were big. Clean. it was simply amazing and comfortable. It almost felt like home when we entered. One thing I wished they had, a bath tub. The walk in shower was comfortable, but after a long day of walking the strip it would have been nice to soak our feet in the tub. We were able to get a good deal on the monorail. The monorail station is directly across from Springhill at the Hilton hotel. Wasnt a long walk at all. I recommend staying here if you do not want the rush and craziness of vegas, which is what we were looking for. We wanted a nice quiet stay after a day of walking, drinking and clubbing. It's quite far off the strip so I wouldnt recommend walking there, u can, but its just a lot of walking especially if you plan on staying long on the strip.. Complimentary internet what was very fast. was super convenient. We were unable to use the pool because of the cold weather during our time of stay, but I'm sure it was beautiful. Housekeeping was friendly. We had a microwave and fridge which was convenient as well. Beautiful, bright rooms. Great hotel. Great comfortable stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but inconsistent...”
Reviews.Author: Fish4Stripers
Reviews.Content: Must be the largest SpringHill Suites in Marriott's inventory. Twenty-four stories tall with a massive lobby. We waited to check in for a few minutes, as there was only one girl at the desk. There was a guy there as well, but did a very good job of ignoring us and instead, stared at his phone. He disappeared a few minutes later. The room was beautiful, with a view of the Wynn and Encore. Since I am a Gold Rewards member, I usually get the higher floors with the better views and this did not disappoint. Room was like a sauna when we opened the door, so we set the AC to 68 (the minimum we could) and waited. And waited. And waited. After two hours, the room was only marginally cooler. We called the front desk and within two minutes there was a knock at the door. The engineer knew exactly what the problem was, as it was one they had been experiencing after adjusting the building's overall heat/cool system. Seconds later, cool air was coming out. Later, we needed a corkscrew to open a wine bottle. Call to the front desk. Two minutes later a knock at the door. Gentleman with a corkscrew offering to open our wine. Wouldn't leave it for us, but did offer to open the wine for me. Next morning, breakfast was a throng of people! Several youth soccer teams were at the hotel, in for a state tournement. Despite that, the staff kept things moving very well, constantly replenishing whatever was running low. They were definitely geared for serving several thousand people over a three hour period. There was ample seating and the dining room was kept spotless. As soon as someone vacated their table, there was someone there cleaning it off for the next party. The dining room manager should be congratulated for the speed and efficiency and FRIENDLINESS of his or her staff. Finally, as we were checking out I went to the front desk to get some change for tips. I stood there for probaby a minute while the two people behind the desk carried on a conversation.The female casually turned toward me and acknowledged I was there, and both just looked at me, saying nothing. Finally, I broke the ice and asked for change. Strange.

Reviews.Title: “Very good business hotel with contemporary flair.”
Reviews.Author: Boat-Captain
Reviews.Content: Great for business person or family that wants to be close to the strip, but not caught up in the congestion. Convenient to the convention center. Public areas and rooms have a contemporary feel. Sleeping rooms are large, have comfortable furnishings and are quiet. Bathrooms are a little different with separate toilet room and shower room. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated Hotel and Great GM”
Reviews.Author: r0bem
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice and the set up for the complimentary breakfast is awesome. If I was on business or in the area with family and friends I would def. recommend staying here. The hotel looks really clean and brand new. I had a minor situation but Jamie Caraher, the General Manager really helped and followed up even after my stay. It really showed that Jamie and her staff genuinely care for their guests. If a hotel has an amazing GM there's no telling what amazing things are to come for this hotel. It was easy to find and not far from the strip. It was kind of nice to stay there away from the strip but also being able to get to the strip so quick with a taxi. The cost of the taxi is pretty cheap and when I called the front desk for a taxi, it was ready to go whenever I was. I loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: honnnnny
Reviews.Content: We came to Las Vegas for a family reunion in August 2011. We had 3 adults and 2 children and the acomadations were perfect especially the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very good value in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: GeoffO869
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night having chosen this hotel largely based on the price and favourable reviews - and it certainly didn't disappoint. In fact it was easily the best of all six hotels we stayed in during a recent trip to the USA and Canada. It was easy to find and following check-in also very easy - and free - to park the car in the hotel's own multi-storey car park. From the friendly welcome at check-in - complete with free and yummy cookies - through to the departure the following morning everyone was personable and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The room was fairly spacious and very well equipped and all of the fixtures and fittings looked new and had a nice contemporary feel to them. Cleanliness and presentation was also very good - we didn't use the sofa bed referred to by other reviewers so can't comment on that but our two queen beds were just fine. We actually liked the fact that a toilet and wash hand basin were separate from the shower room as it provided more flexibility and while we didn't take advantage of the small kitchen area it too was nicely equipped. The included breakfast was comprehensive and of very good quality - and no sign here of everything being cleared away one minute before the official end of service as we had encountered elsewhere. The roof-top pool and patio area offered stunning views of the whole Vegas conurbation - as did the window from our room come to think of it. Getting to the strip is easy - either drive get a cab or do as we did and walk over to either the Convention Centre or the Hilton and board the monorail which is modern gives some nice views and will drop you near Caesars Palace and Bellagio in just a few minutes. Overall we really enjoyed our stay - and although we have no immediate plans to return would certainly use the Springhill Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Bed Bugs and weird Bathroom =(”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa M
Reviews.Content: I Know someone who stayed here and got bed bug bites!!! If you plan on staying here good luck because the bed bugs can travel home with you and suck your blood while you are sleeping. I wouldn't want anyone I know to stay here. I think its also annoying that the toilet is not in the same room as the shower. The toilet is in a tiny space that has a tiny sink..very weird!!! DO NOT STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “No casino, business hotel. Near a cellular antennas.”
Reviews.Author: avri
Reviews.Content: New hotel without casino! Next to the Convention Center. Including reasonable breakfast. Design of the room is modern but the washroom that is next to the bed, is bothering. Important point to those that are bothered of cellular radiation. Attached to the hotel is situated a pole loaded with cellular antennas. Possibly that also in other hotels exist antennas like these but they are not visible like here. Picture attached. There is in the room 2 water bottles that cost quite high. Pay attention. In summary: new, excellent hotel for business. Good also for leisure if you have a vehicle that will take you to the center of activity. Ask for a distant room from the cellular antenna.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: scottmandy37
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed Saturday night for one night only. There were 3 of us and my friend and I slept on the bed and our other friend slept on the sofa bed. She grabbed the extra bedding and pillow from the closet to use. We checked out super early on Sunday like by 7am to avoid traffic back to LA. My friend who slept on the sofa noticed she had a few bites on her stomach and back which looked like mosquito bites. We didn't think anything of it and we were rushing to drive back home. The next morning my friend calls me and tells me she found more bites and that the ones on the back of her thigh were in a line which is very weird. We have heard stories of bed bug bites and as we goggled more info. the bites my friend had were indeed bed bug bites. She contacted the hotel the next day to see if they had other reports and for them to inspect the room. The assistant gm she spoke with was very rude and didn't believe her. The hotel conducted their own investigation of the bed bugs and told my friend they didn't find any and asked if she went to see a doctor yet. She did see a doctor who verified they were bug bites and not spider or mosquito bites. The hotel denies bed bugs but I honestly know that my friend got them from sleeping on that sofa bed or even from the bedding from the closet. It is sad that the hotel is not being sympathetic and more defensive in a really bad way. I guess the hotel also had their pest control expertise check the room and had sent my friend the actual report. It was negative for pest activity but it didn't show specifically the areas that were thoroughly checked. It is just really weird and crazy at what lengths the hotel would do to avoid any bed bug drama. Their first concern should be the safety of the guests. After reading info on bed bugs they really are no joke and can spread. My friend had to sanitize everything and wash everything. Those things can travel with you in your luggage and one single bed bug can lay 300-500 eggs. I would highly recommend not staying at this hotel. The Residence Marriott or Las Vegas Marriott is way better and has better service.

Reviews.Title: “Right across the street from both the Convention Centre and Mono Rail station”
Reviews.Author: v98roadstar
Reviews.Content: Great location for Convention Centre attendees, nice hot breakfast and eating area. Front desk staff are first rate, and the on site cafe and bar has great food, but a limited menu. Rooms only have a shower, and would have loved a tub after a long day of walking if for nothing else simply just a place to soak my feet. Rooms are nice, beds are very comfortable, and the hotel is non smoking only. The only draw back would have to be the room cleaning staff, little to no effort was made to tidy the room, and in the 4 days no vacuuming was done, and yes I left a nice tip each day. Overall I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: mikeythebe
Reviews.Content: On Paradise, just behind the Riviera which is an easy walk is a great new hotel. First class all the way, the people, the rooms, the breakfast which is included. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “SpringHill Suites-Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kerry T
Reviews.Content: Great value in Las Vegas.....Enjoyed the breakfast.....friendly and courteous staff. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel Just Off the Strip is Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Gina G
Reviews.Content: Located just off the strip, close to the convention center, and located in just the right spot for being somewhat quiet with easy access to the action with the Riviera casino just behind the hotel. The room was new and modern with a somewhat european style bathroom set up including a giant glass-encased shower with tiled walls illuminated by indirect lighting strategically placed throughout. The pool and fitness area, located on the roof, had nearly 360 degree views of Vegas and the mountains that surround it. The breakfast was unexpectedly great with everything from cereal and pastries to eggs and waffles and, of course, the essential coffee. The "suite" part of the room worked out great to sit and relax with some of my local Vegas friends and co-workers. Overall an excellent place to stay if your on a buget and/or don't need a casino or theme hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, but staff.....”
Reviews.Author: L F
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable, location good to save a little, with good breakfast but not open very long. I left clothes behind in the closet, don't expect to get your things back if you leave something behind. No call back or followup when I realized I had left things. I had to do all the work and still got only "sorry". Yes, it was my fault for leaving something but I would like to have gotten it back. Lynne at Front Desk was great at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quite Comfy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveler007_007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a nice little oasis from the hustle and bustle of the Las Vegas strip. The bed was very comfortable and the linen were clean and soft. The staff was also very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, staff is incompetent”
Reviews.Author: rockies411
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights for show at convention center. 10 minute walk to convention center. Breakfast is great. Rooms are comfortable, but have odd lay out. (Toilet in different room than shower/ sink) Called for wake up call my first night, which never came in the AM (Luckily I set my phone alarm). Older african american lady at front desk who worked afternoon/evening shift had MAJOR attitude. I had her call cab for group of us for dinner. After waiting outside for 10-15 min, I came back in and she said she couldn't get a hold of any cabs. Don't understand how hard it would be to walk outside and let us know this? Just overall an unpleasant human during several interactions with myself and my team. Unfortunately, the terrible service from her is what I will take away from my stay. Other staff was helpful and friendly. She was the 'bad apple'.

Reviews.Title: “A great relaxing stay- keep this place on your radar!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLiveaboard
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were in Vegas for a Navy reunion; the host hotel was the Golden Nugget (the reunion planner had set up lodging there). I'm not a fan of casino hotels at all. My girlfriends' daughter works for the Marriott, and we selected this hotel. While not as exciting as being on the Strip, there's a certain comfort to not dealing with continuous casino clamor, cigarette smoke, overtly drunken fools, etc, etc. The rooms are comfortable, the staff is excellent, the breakfast is welcome and filling. Wi-fi and parking is included, and there are no hidden resort fees to contend with. The strip is close enough- but not too close. In short, a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: RoadtripperTucson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here several times over the last few years. I hotel is fairly new and is conveniently located off the freeway and close to the strip. A short walk across the street gives you access to the monorail for a quick and less expensive trip to the strip. Free parking is covered and the roof top pool has a great view. We particularly like the layout of these rooms which have a separated bathroom. The rooms are large and comfortable. Breakfast is served downstairs and espresso drinks are available at an extra charge.

Reviews.Title: “Updated Hotel Off Strip”
Reviews.Author: pickitravelerNash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Springhill Suites in April 2011 for 2 nights on business. The hotel was very reasonably priced at around $100/night. The room was spacious with the sitting area that is in all Springhill Suites. The rooms and lobby area are modern. The lobby includes a limited restaurant and bar. Snacks (expensive) can be purchased at the front desk. Room service is available. The rooftop pool has a very nice view and a fire pit (for use when it's cold outside I suppose) but the pool is very small with no shaded seating. The workout room seemed adequate although I did not use it. The breakfast provides fairly good options with fruit, pastries, meat, eggs and even oatmeal with toppings. The hotel was not within walking distance of the strip for those in heels but a short cab drive away. I would stay here again for business but would stay on the strip for leisure in LV.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, modern, close to convention center”
Reviews.Author: saraga1908
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel when staying in Vegas for an HR conference at the Convention Center. I stayed for 3 nights. My room was very clean and I loved the set up. The bathroom is separated with the toilet and sink behind one door and the shower and a sink behind another. While I was staying alone, this is really ideal when staying together as a couple in the room because no one has to wait to get ready while the other person showers. I also liked the fact that the hotel isn't attached to a casino and all of the smoke and drunk people wandering around. The breakfast was decent, but definitely need to get down there EARLY or all the good stuff is gone. If walking to the convention center, there is an indoor walkway that crosses over the main road and exits in the visitor center which is on the same side of the road as the hotel. There is a gas station right next to the hotel which was great for small snacks, water, etc. Easy to board the tram that travels along the strip by getting on at the station across the street at the Hilton. My only disappointments with the hotel - ate in the restaurant one night and the attendant obviously wanted to be elsewhere, but the food was good and hot. Also, called ahead to see if I could check in early and was told no, wish someone would have mentioned I could drop off my luggage so I didn't have to haul it around at the convention for several hours the first day. I took the grey (gray?) line bus from the airport. It's really a shuttle bus and was only like $13 round trip - super easy. Easy to walk over to the strip by cutting through the parking lot and entering the Riviera Hotel and Casino. I would recommend this hotel for anyone attending a conference in Vegas or visiting for fun but not wanting the noise and chaos 24/7 of the strip. I was also surprised at being off the strip and still finding the sidewalk littered with pornographic cards promoting different strip clubs. So even though it's a family friendly hotel, make sure your kids aren't looking down when you go outside. Oh!! the view from the pool area on the roof is fantastic! Take a few minutes and head upstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel - would stay again if price is right”
Reviews.Author: damieniz1
Reviews.Content: I always like to rate hotels based on value. Staying here on a weekend night for under $80 would be of great value. Found a great rate and can not complain about this hotel. Easy to find, welcoming lobby and nice clean room. Not crazy about the fact they still use a comforter rather than a duvet but overall not bad. Great $50-80 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ParisekX
Reviews.Content: WIFI is really fast 8mbit up/down. Very luxurious interior and superb view from window.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit Not As Good”
Reviews.Author: Biztraveler2222
Reviews.Content: My first visit to this property was two years ago for a convention across the street and I had high praise for the property with a few minor issues. This recently trip in August for 6 days was for pleasure and it did not fare as well. I appreciate the non-smoking, non-gaming format. Upon arrival I was told that my room request could not be met because the carpets were being cleaned on the higher floors. The next morning, a knock on my door at 7:30 by the rug cleaner person asking if he can come into my room to clean the carpets. The room itself is average. The lighting is terrible: for example, over the bed is a fluorescent strip light. Not the best lighitng to read by. The entire room is lit by fluorescent lighting. There is virtually no furniture to store you clothes so you will be living out of your suitcase. Cabs are not availalbe and you will have to walk across the street to the Hilton. The monorail is also at the Hilton which is convenient but in 108 degree heat, the walk can be oppressive. The complimentary breakfast is OK - should really run for another hour. It's interesting that they have a bowl of fresh fruit available at breakfast but after the breakfast is over, they charge you for the fruit. No complimentary coffee, decaf or tea throughout the day. The cafe is small but the food quality is good. Pricing is not that bad considering there aren't any restaurants in the area except for the aging Hilton across the street. The rooms come with a small fridge and microwave oven. Overall, if you are attending a convention, this hotel is a good deal. Otherwise, look around elswhere. Quick Tip: Check with the hotel to make sure there aren't any events going on at the hotel. It would also be a good idea to check the Las Vegas Convention Center for the same.

Reviews.Title: “bad service and would never stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: jasmin b
Reviews.Content: The girl who help me at the front desk told me i was on the 11th floor and gave me my key. That was it. Didnt say another word to me i had to ask her if that was it. She did not tell me where the elevator was or the hours of the complemtary breakfast or that we had to use our room key to get into the parking lot located in the back of the hotel. They were not informative or friendly whats so ever. I went to the bar and the girl there was the same way. Worst service ive ever had at a Marriot truely disappointed would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travelers, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ruby_slippers11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during a tradeshow. I selected it because I did not want a hotel with a casino and this was just great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I especially loved the Gingered Pear Martini made by Lina... Fantastic and she couldn't have been nicer. I ate there every night and the food was good. After a long work day I really appreciated this hotel. It is new and the room was very nice and clean. I will definitley stay again. If you have an event at the Convention Center, this is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Spot in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: I wanted a spot that did not have a casino, but was convenient to the Strip. This hotel does not have a casino (yeah!) so coming back to the hotel is a relaxing vs. obnoxious experience and is only a 5 min walk to the monorail. The rooms were large and held our family of 5 comfortably - queen beds plus a large pullout including a powder room, allowing "dual bathroom usage". Buffet breakfast in a very comfortable setting, with a wide variety of breads, cereals, fruits and hot dishes including strawberry waffles - always a hit with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay in a Long Time”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent. Everything from the cleanliness of the rooms to the friendly and helpful staff was superb. It was quiet and yet only 1 block from the strip and there is a monrail stop just across the street. Hot breakfast is included too. Great location and value. I will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Hthebloke
Reviews.Content: Perfect for Vegas. I didn't want to be on the strip so this was perfect. Rooftop pool, and fitness. The rooms were perfect. Even the food in the restaurant was good and the kitchen was open till 23h.

Reviews.Title: “Good Marriott choice in LV”
Reviews.Author: edtoby007
Reviews.Content: This property is going on 3 years old, in excellent shape. Rooms clean and comfortable, nicely sized. A huge expansive lobby with the best breakfast I've seen yet for the SH brand. Located across from the LV Hilton and in back of the Riviera. I chose this property as opposed to the full service Marriott across the street due to the luke warm comments appearing here in TA. Free parking also a plus. Small full sized bar, no slot machines. Good choice for both the business traveler and tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Viva las springhill”
Reviews.Author: Ponchoandlefty
Reviews.Content: For a select service hotel, you get a lot. Staff is friendly and eager to help. Property is modern, and swanky when it comes to design.

Reviews.Title: “Massive Spring Hill”
Reviews.Author: gotarev
Reviews.Content: This one of the largest Spring Hill I have seen. People are nice and rooms are you'd expect with Spring Hill. However, due to its size breakfast is loud and very busy. Not too far from the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Like Home...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRphFlorida
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online in advance for our family vacations in Las Vegas. Price was great. The hotel is right in front of the Hilton on a quiet road two blocks away from the strip. The hotel was really nice, rooms were very clean & well designed. Friendly people all over from reception to kitchen ladies. This is a family hotel, not one of those casino/Hotels that can be found on the strip. Breakfast was really nice too. I was VERY pleased with the whole experience. I definitely recommend it if your going with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Big room , decent view of a big sign... Safe”
Reviews.Author: barcelonabrat
Reviews.Content: I can't give an excellent but a very good. I felt safe. Maybe the hotel just feels like it needs a facelift. It's busy. The garage is nice because you don't have to valet park. I like that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Marriott Property. Free Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: willis2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sprinhill Suites last July with my cousin. She didn't want to stay at a Casino Hotel and since I am a Marriott Member, I wanted to pick a Marriott property. I chose the Springhill Suites since it was pretty new around the time we stayed last year. The rooms were nice, clean and very modern. It is off the strip across from the Las Vegas Hilton if any of you know where that is. We always rent a car so getting to the strip and around was okay for us. The free buffet breakfast was nice. Nothing elaborate but more than enough. Eggs, Bacon, Potatoes, Oatmeal, Cereal etc..... The price for the hotel was good and I would stay there again if I didn't want to stay in a Casino hotel or needed to save a few bucks but I usually stay at the huge hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: SaltLakeCityBiff
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and very new looking, decorated beautifully, good views. Good continental breakfast, for free, along with free, secure covered parking makes it a great deal. Hotel was quiet, couldn't smell cigarette smoke anywhere inside, and in a good location. This hotel is directly across the street from the Las Vegas Hilton and the Convention Center; each have a monorail stop. Having a monorail stop so close makes it a very convenient location - not being on the strip is not a drawback at all. If you're not into staying at hotels with swank spas and overpriced boutiques this is the best choice. This hotel has everything you need - clean, new rooms, great free breakfast, free parking, quiet atmosphere so you can actually sleep, and very accessible location. Great value for the dollar, especially since thier rates are lower than many strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rreese4
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, very quiet, staff is friendly and helpful - especially the front desk. The look is very modern, breakfast was fine - what you would expect in a complimentary breakfast buffet. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rrrolo
Reviews.Content: I was in LV for a 4 day conference and stayed at the SpringHill Suites. It was an ideal location since my conference was at the convention center - one can easily walk to the convention center from the hotel. However, beyond the location, the hotel is amazing. I was blown away by the lobby decor, the level of service provided by the staff and wowed by the guest room decor. To boot, the complimentary breakfast exceeded by expecations. After a long day at a conference, the last thing I wanted to do was go out and hit the town; therefore, I took advantage of the lobby bar. The food and beer selection (for other bevie lovers, they also have wine and spirits) meet my needs perfectly to unwind and refuel to get me ready for the next day.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: frogsandcows
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend and it was a pleasant surprise. This was our first time staying off of the strip, so we weren't sure what to expect. The hotel is very modern and clean. The rooms were very spacious & comfortable and the decor was very tasteful. We found the amenities provided to be sufficient and loved the rooftop pool! Parking on-site was complimentary and there was plenty available. A cab ride to the end of the strip was about $10, and a ride to downtown/Fremont Street was about $15. The Hilton is right across the street and offers access to the Monorail. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: BigdawgChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three days. Overall, very good property. Lobby very large and modern. Room modern and comfortable with flat screen HD TV. Free wifi worked fine and nice work area. Free breakfast had very good variety and although very, very crowded, the seating area is huge so we always found a place to sit. There were a few teen girl fastpitch baseball teams at the hotel and the front desk honored my request to be on a floor they were not on. Our room was very quiet. Garage had ample parking although the first time you want to park in the garage, the access can be a bit confusing. Overall, a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott forgot to put drawers in the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Eileencooks
Reviews.Content: Used my Marriott points from half of a travel package for 7 nights. Here is the good news: Hotel lobby area is lovely. Free breakfast - enormous and well cooked and presented. Beds fantastic and slept in the quietest room ever. Late night room service fast and fabulous - Filet sliders med. rare was perfect at 10:45 p.m.! Staff at front desk was personable and helpful and wanted us to check after 2 days to see if a King bed room with a tub would come available but instead moved across the street for the last 3 nights as a tub was important to soak in for arthritis. Here is the not so good news. Breakfast great but no trays to take breakfast up to one's room so forced to sit downstairs other than a cup of coffee in a to go cup. Room - well, here are the problems. There are two tiny lingerie drawers in the entire room - no bedside tables with a drawer. No drawers in the miniature closet. For a one week stay or even 3 nights, you'll have to live out of your suitcase and there isn't much room for that. Microwave could fall off the shelf if you happen to lean on the open door. Fridge and microwave great for warming up one person frozen meals and keeping drinks cold. Air conditioner great but it is inside the room under the luggage shelf and you cannot put things on the shelf or air is blocked. Also they could use some thicker towels for their showers. Rating it as a Marriott 5 is amazing since I have stayed in other Marriott, 4's, 5's, and 6' hotels and this was more like a stackable motel type room and cheaply made and furnished. Everything felt cheap and not like any other Marriott I have ever stayed in the past 20 years. How can any hotel have only two tiny drawers for a double Queen room. There is a difference between simple and uncluttered vs. cheap and flimsy. Won't stay here again due to no place for my clothes. I'd rate it a 3 level.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great customer service - Definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Brayden0416
Reviews.Content: A very clean, professionally ran hotel that gives a consistent Marriott level of service to the guest. Located near the convention center and Hilton, it is only a $10 cab ride to either end of the strip and within waking distance to the Wynn and properties in that area. The rooms are clean, great for family or those travelers wanting to go to Vegas but not have to walk through smoky casinos for 20 minutes trying to find registration and another 10 getting to the elevators. This hotel features a full breakfast with hot foods and even offers turkey sausage which is great for a non- pork eater. The on-site bar offers excellent entrees for dinner as well. The rooftop pool is unique and offers commanding views of the Vegas skyline or desert sky to to east. For business or family travel, I highly recommend this location. I've stayed twice in the last 3 months and plan to do so again the next time I go to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: momofakk
Reviews.Content: The hotel environment can be described as simply comfortable. Just a few areas of concern. The carpet did not meet the "white sock" test. Also, the housekeepers would not get around to cleaning the room until after 2pm each day. Hotel also needs to inspect the ground texture around the pool, very slippery! Other than that, I would stay here again and would recommend this non-smoking hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet night in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Mario1986
Reviews.Content: Close enough to walk to the strip, but far enough to avoid the noise of the strip. Good hotel, clean, provided free wi-fi, parking and breakfast. Breakfast was a good variety, also like that employee would go around tables and for those parents that can't control their kids they would provide coloring material. If you want to see the whole strip we recommend looking at the bus schedule and different options right outside the hotel because it can be a long walk. Had a very nice and quiet sleep, no noise at all.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for convention or business travel”
Reviews.Author: SLM941
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel when I was recently at a conference at the LV Hilton for six days. You're not nickled-and-dimed as is usual there and the included breakfast was great! It's a new building and the staff is helpful and friendly. Housekeeping is spotless and I like the security of the keyed elevators to the guest floors. Nice, good-sized workout center and a little pool (too hot out there for me!). You can get to the monorail thru the Hilton but, no, it's not in a great location. But if you need to be up near the Convention Center and want a restful night's sleep, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Shannon1966
Reviews.Content: I go to Las Vegas every year for a convention and it is nice to stay a smaller clean hotel that I can walk to the convention center. Rooms were comfortable and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with everything you need!”
Reviews.Author: KnockingOutObesity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SpringHill Suites when we were on our national Knocking Out Obesity tour. We traveled through 28 cities and stayed at many hotels. This was our favorite! Beautiful, great room design and full of all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option in Vegas for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Coach5000
Reviews.Content: The SpringHill Suites at the Las Vegas Convention Center is a nice option for the business traveler. The property is close to the strip and the desired Las Vegas attractions, but far enough away that you can separate yourself from the crowds when ready. Dining and transportation is close by, and the airport is a short taxi ride away. This hotel has a nice pool on the roof and the fitness center is quite large for a SpringHill. Parking is handled by a large garage on-site, but one must take an elevator from the garage to the hotel lobby in order to reach your room. Somewhat inconvenient, but parking is ample and the elevators are fast. The complimentary breakfast selection is on par with most other Springhill properties, but the quantity of food and seating is extraordinary. The staff at the hotel is very pleasant and professional, and very willing to help with directions, dining suggestions, etc. I would highly recommend this hotel for any traveler visiting Las Vegas that wants to be close to the action but not part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't go Back”
Reviews.Author: DGoodman
Reviews.Content: I had a seminar at the Mirage and wanted to stay somewhere without a smoke filled casino so I thought I would try the SpringHill Suites. I was disappointed by several things here. First of all, when I arrived there was no valet parking, only a far away garage which has to be accessed with a room key, which means parking the car twice. I felt that $140.00 (including tax) was too expensive for what I received. The room was small, claustrophobic and poorly decorated. There was a clashing thick stripe of paint above the laminate wood bed which felt like it had not yet been painted. The bathroom door was heavy, awkward and right in front of the bed. The window of the room was dirty as well as the tables at the breakfast buffet which closed too early. The room felt like being on a train. I was not comfortable with the narrowness or the colors and would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: lowen0582
Reviews.Content: This is located walking distance from the strip. There is also a bus stop right down the street which makes it a lot easier to get around. The staff was VERY friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful. Very modern. The beds were the most comfortable thing I've slept on! The only complaint, the pool is only 4 1/2 feet deep. It's really cool on the roof, but super tiny. But I didn't stay there for the pool. I would always stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: regaffman
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with the family. Late arrival - reception was friendly.Very nice clean modern room on the high floor with good city look. Parking fully occupied - spent a time to find the place. Breakfast rather good but again the area fully occupied and slightly noisy - difficult to find a place. Convenient location by car but not really walking distance to main street. Overall - very good would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for conventions and those who want to be close to the excitement but not in the middle of it”
Reviews.Author: TeamJJJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and overall it was a delightful experience. This hotel is about 4 min walk from the convention center and across the street from the Hilton which is also connected to the convention center. It was easy for me to attend my meetings which were hosted by the Hilton and Convention Center. The rooms were spacious and modern, the layout was great. The beds were comfortable and there were even iPod docking stations in the room! A pleasant surprise. My only complaint, which I noticed several other people mention, is that the towels and bath linens are HORRID. Very small and rough! I was very disappointed and even shocked, as they did not match the rest of the hotel in quality overall. I've gotten better towels for $5 at Wal-Mart; that should tell you something. Breakfast each morning was nice, served only from about 6:30-9am. Front desk staff were friendly and pleasant. I felt safe at this location as a woman traveling alone (you must use your room key to use the elevators). Would definitely recommend this to any of my friends/family traveling for a conference. It's close enough to the strip that you can get there within minutes if needed. I could see the Wynn/Encore from the area I was staying. Overall, a pleasant stay. I'll definitely look for SpringHill suites when I travel again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying Vegas At A Distance”
Reviews.Author: CnR_Azusa_California
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised by this Marriott property! Located just off Paradise and Sahara, this hotel is away from all the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas... but just a short walk away, and you're back in the middle of the gambling, drinking, and all the pleasantries associated with Sin City. The hotel has a very trendy feel to it... Walking into the lobby, you're greeted by a very friendly staff, and a very budget-chic appearance... Trendy, but without the snobbish attitude. Wonderful views available from this hotel... at night, the scenary is just spectacular. Rooms are spacious... The restroom is divided from the main bedroom by a frosted glass door. Different, and a bit invasive of privacy, but it's alright. Spring Hills also houses a very nice pool area on the 24th floor, and a cozy gym area as well. Overall, a very versatile hotel... Only complaint is very minor... the air conditioning unit isn't very user friendly, and is continuously running. Perhaps we didn't understand how to work it properly, but it affected us enough to the point that we rated this hotel down to a 4. We would come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Surprise, Well Excuted for the Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: Ellenwood
Reviews.Content: I did not plan to stay here but a bad experience at another Vegas hotel forced me to find other accommodations and I am really glad I found this place! This is first and foremost a well planned and executed business hotel. It is located just a block from the convention center. The Hilton is located across the street (past a very expansive parking lot) for the gamblers out there. The SpringHill reminds me a little of the the Hyatt Place concept but the SpringHill suites blows Hyatt Place out of the water. Front desk personnel are a significant notch above most you find at most hotels. They are friendly, courteous, professional, informative, and helpful. All personnel I encountered at the hotel displayed these same traits. You can tell these people were not flipping burger before working there. I noticed a guy on the phone who needed to check his bags. The front desk clerk carried out the operation without interrupting the guys conversation or displaying an attitude since the guy was on the phone. Check-in was a breeze. I had a room on the 20th floor with a view of the Wynn Golf course and that side of the strip. The room is not a"suite" in the The Hotel sense but was spacious nonetheless. The airconditioner cooled the room very quickly. A refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker is in the room. The work area is well designed and excuted for the business traveller. There are plenty of power outlets, more than adequate lighting and a hassle-free internet connection. The bed is very comfortable, includes a down duvet, and has numerous pillows of various firmness (a nice touch). The unexpected includes true high definition TV picture quality, a 24th floor roof top pool, seating area, fire pit, and gym with fabulous views of the strip. The free breakfast includes items for the business traveller to grab and go (whole fruits, pastries & coffee to go) but it also includes eggs, turkey sausage, Juices, oatmeal with various toppings, various cereals, bagels, English muffins and a Belgium waffle maker. The seating area was overly large for the size of the hotel which allowed guests to spread out their morning paper and not be jammed up to the next person. Security as others have mentioned includes keys required to access the rooftop pool area, gym, parking lot, and elevator access to you floor. The elevator from the parking area opens just before the registration area forcing guests to go past the always manned front desk. This place definitely makes the business traveller fell at home and saves money as well. Food is very expensive in Vegas and the free breakfast is a big plus. Most Vegas hotels charge daily resort fee (around $15) which includes internet and access to a matchbook sized cardio area. Internet and access to the nicely equipped rooftop gym are included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten path, yet close. Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: spade7
Reviews.Content: As a frequent Marriott customer, I gave this off-strip hotel a shot, and am I ever glad I did. This hotel is a block off the strip, across from the Las Vegas Hilton. Not a casino property so all the traffic in and out of the hotel is just hotel traffic. There's plenty of free parking in the attached garage if you have a car -- the only annoyance is that you must take an elevator down to the lobby from the garage and then a separate set of elevators back up to your room. Plenty of parking though. If you do drive, it is very easy to avoid the traffic on the Strip. If you don't drive, a walk across the street to the Hilton gets you monorail access. The rooms are modern and clean. I didn't like the bathroom being split into two separate rooms, but that was my only complaint. There is a rooftop pool and scenic overview from the 24th floor; great for taking some pictures. Breakfast was well-stocked and had hot food items, and there was a ton of seating space. Check-in/Check-out was also extremely fast, and after seeing the check-in lines at some of the casino resorts I felt even better about my choice. I absolutely loved this hotel, and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “For the business traveler, this could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: SMG61
Reviews.Content: If your going to the Las Vegas Convention Center and don't need the casino drama, then this would be an excellent choice. The staff was second to none (especially the 3pm -11pm desk)..... Remember, everything is always a cab ride away......

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: mabenavidez
Reviews.Content: My team and I stayed at this hotel for the second year in a row. We were in town to participate in an athletic event. The hotel offered a discount on both hotel rooms and banquet room exclusive to our team for the event. I requested early check-in when I made my web reservation. When I arrived at about 8 am, I attempted to check-in knowing that it may be a bit too early. To my surprise, I was allowed to check-in, but the staff member stated that she was not normally allowed to check persons in this early. I appreciated the very early check-in, but it felt like I was doing something wrong by allowing the staff member to check me in that early. The rest of my experience was fantastic! The breakfast buffet is fantastic, as well as the rooms and work-out facility. Furthermore, this hotel is directly across the street from a Las Vegas Monorail station.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, one of the best motels we stayed in in the USA”
Reviews.Author: juzmuz
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got there and we were welcomed to the hotel by the most polite and helpful front desk staff member (Rena) we came across in the USA. The rooms and facilities were all clean and tidy and we felt very comfotable at stages of our family stay. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TheresaZ_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at this hotel with my husband. The room was very roomy, clean and comfortable. We could see the view of the nearby golf course and the bright lights of the Las Vegas strip from a distance from our room. We felt safe and liked the idea of having a security pass to even get to our floor; this prevents people from just walking around. The hotel is very quiet in the evenings. The pool on the roof top was a treat, especially the beautiful views of all Las Vegas. We also enjoyed the very delicious breakfast buffet each morning. The free parking in a well lighted and secure parking garage is also a plus. I will definately stay again at this location and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop”
Reviews.Author: hammerdroogs
Reviews.Content: Stayed the night with family (3 young children) and it was great. Room was very clean, it was quiet, and enjoyed an excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Truck broken into. Warning, unsecured garage.”
Reviews.Author: TradeshowMagician
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and all, and the location is convenient. But, the garage is unsecured and not monitored. My Truck has a bed cover and a tailgate lock. And I always lock the tailgate empty or full. I guess a locked tailgate was worth breaking into because someone had the time to drill out the lock resulting in $467 worth of damage. There was no security or video cameras to deter the crime. Lucky for me, my truck bed was empty, but the damage was still done. The hotel and Marriott corporate tell me that it is my fault and I parked at my own risk. Next time I'll save my $467 by investing in a hotel upgrade and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Well Designed - They thought of just about everything!”
Reviews.Author: Trish246
Reviews.Content: I chose the SpringHill Suites because of the proximity to the Convention Center, the newness of the hotel, and because I've had positive experiences in other Marriotts. Turns out the SpringHill is even closer to the Convention Center that I thought from the maps. A very short walk across the street and down the sidewalk. Also - easy access to the monorail through the Hilton which is across the street. The gals at the reception were warm and friendly. No wait at all to check in. There is a great little "market" instead of the typical vending machines with just about anything I could think of. I ended up buying ice cream, bottled water, sunscreen and Dramamine there. Not cheap, but really nice to have available on the spot. They had a great breakfast buffet that we took advantage of one of our two mornings. Steel cut oatmeal with self serve toppings of almonds, brown sugar or raisins, fresh cut fruit, eggs (which were good), turkey sausage patties, a few different juices, cereal, toast, bagels, waffles, really good muffins.... there was such a nice selection I can't remember it all. Lots of places to sit down to eat too in their really nicely designed lobby area. My only wish would have been for breakfast to run longer than 9:00am. Our room was on the 18th floor overlooking the Crazy Girls Passion Pit sign from a neighboring business... so not the best view, but the room itself was great. I'm not sure why they call them suites, but I still really liked the layout. We had two queen beds and a nice office/work area. Fridge, microwave, free wireless internet, outlets by the bed to charge our phones, iPod ready clock radio. The bathroom layout was really nice too. Two separate spaces with sliding doors so they didn't take any floor space. One had a sink and shower and the other had a sink and toilet. Made it really easy to get ready in the morning. I really liked the finishes too. Nice back-lit mirrors, frosted glass in the sliding doors, nice faucets. Duvet style comforters instead of sheets and scary, scratchy bedspreads. Sofa with a chaise lounge and throw pillows. There were just so many little things that were well designed it really made what could have been a pretty basic room feel really nice and very comfortable. Things like the built in luggage rack over the heater/air conditioner at the window. What a great way to make the space functional. Flat screen TV that we could swing from the lounging/desk area to the bed area. Adjustable shower head...simple feature but makes a big difference in how nice my shower feels to me. It look me a while to figure out how to get the lights over the beds to turn on/off until I discovered the switch at the door had to be on first. It would have been nice to have a little table on both sides of the beds. The 24th floor roof top pool is really nice too. There is a fountain wall on one side and nice music playing up there that really help create a relaxing escape from the noise of the city. The water was warm and we were fortunate the wind was low the day we were able to relax in the pool. The following day it was pretty windy and wouldn't have been as nice. Once you are wet it ends up being warmer in the pool than out due to the breeze. There is also a fire pit on the roof, but I didn't see anyone using it. There isn't a hot tub though. Not sure why. Nice fitness center on the roof too, but we didn't use it... just peeked in. Great security. Needed our room key to access any of the floors with rooms or the pool - up or down in the elevator. Also needed it to get into the building when we returned late one night. It worked every time.. first try everywhere we used it. It really made us feel more secure. I think the 2 - 7th floors are just parking which seems like a great design... making all the rooms up fairly high. There were lunch and dinner dining options (room service at night) as well, but I'm not sure if those were available because of the big trade show (NAB) or if they are always available. I had a really good roasted vegetable wrap for lunch down in the lounge area that I would highly recommend. It was so big I took the last 1/3 up to our room and put it in our fridge and was able to finish it for a snack the next day. Everyone we crossed paths with that worked there was really nice and friendly. Our gal who did housekeeping for our room was super sweet and went back to take care of our room when we met her waiting to get on the elevator. Check out was super simple. They left a printout with all of our charges outside our door in the middle of the night the night before our check out. Best part was check out at 12:00 noon. Nice. Slept in and missed the yummy breakfast... it was just another nice touch that made me feel compelled to write my first hotel review ever. I was just continually happy here and really could have stayed much, much longer. It is that nice and relaxing. One of the fun things about the SpringHill is it is VERY unassuming from the outside... especially compared to everywhere else in Las Vegas. It almost felt like we were entering through some side door or something. Makes it feel all the more special. I feel like we've discovered a hidden gem away from the casinos where we can just relax while we are on a working 'vacation'.... but with super easy access to the monorail so we can easily get around the strip without a car. I'm actually looking forward to having to visit Las Vegas again for work since I've found the SpringHill.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: mjuliennow
Reviews.Content: No flashy extras, no charge for local calls or internet, just a simple, clean, relatively spacious room and a basic breakfast (eggs, ham, oatmeal, toast, cereal, buns, yogurt, whole fruit) for a decent price. Monorail across the street at the Hilton gets you to Harrahs in about 15 minutes. Only problem I had was getting hot water in the shower one morning - it eventually got warm but not hot that one day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: forts1980
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I really appreciated our stay at the Springhill Suites. We were on 22nd floor and it was really quiet. The suite was clean and we had a great view. The free hot buffet offered every morning was delicious. The hotel is in front of the monorail station, so it is very easy to have access to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: shoegirl96
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I were on a girls trip to Vegas. We loved this hotel but the location was not our first choice. The staff were nice and the rooftop pool was perfect too. If I were travelling for work this hotel would have worked. Since this was a girls trip we had to get to hotel on the strip. If you are looking to relax and not be in the action this hotel will work for you and your family. However, if you want to be in the action its kind of a hike to & from the strip. No casino on site, this hotel could be anytown USA, but if you want action choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: Hobart01
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 day conference at the Convention Center across the street. This hotel is the perfect location because it's about a 2 minute walk door-to-door. The room is great, view is great, and the service. I had bad luck and got a broken shower knob so I had 2 cold showers, but the staff has been gracious enough to work it out with me. If you stay here take a trip to the 24th floor at night to look out over the city or enjoy the fireplace. Breakfast was good (I only eat granola every morning and they had that so...). I would recommend this place. It is also a block from the bus stop which can take you to/from the airport or downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with all categories rated A+--friendly, clean, modern, great bed, quiet, great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: Tasca6366
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel near Las Vegas Strip but not the madness of casino hotels. Friendly staff, free internet in room, security elevators, comfortable bed and room modern and updated. Very nice included buffet breakfast. Computers in lobby for use at no charge and free printing. Secure parking garage which is also free. Great place to stay in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice..... Not on the strip, but very close.”
Reviews.Author: JamesTraveler
Reviews.Content: Very new, across from the Hilton/Convention Center. Near monorail. Lobby is beautiful. Parking is easy. Rooms are spacious, very quiet, very clean. Internet/TV were excellent. Breakfast was wonderful. Great for business travel - very quiet, non-smoking hotel, no casino.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: BobbiJoPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: Microwave, frig, and coffee maker a plus. Breakfast buffett included in price and is very nice. Room service food so-so. Free Wi-fi. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it is clean...”
Reviews.Author: TseugLetoh
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the people that shout CLEAN!!! in their reviews. It's a must for every hotel to be clean, and certainly not that rare. If you have only stayed in dirty hotels before, then you are rightly impressed with Springhill Suites Las Vegas Convention Center. If not, you must have noticed something else that I have noticed, too. 1. The breakfast ENDS at 9:00 AM, even on the day after Thanksgiving! This is too early for Las Vegas, where many shows end after midnight. Then it's your choice to miss: either some sleep, or the breakfast you have already paid for. On 11/26/2010 at about 8:00 AM, there was a huge line of guests for breakfast. Yes, the lobby where the line stood, was CLEAN!!! 2. The king bed has only one night stand - not good for a couple. 3. The alarm clock is fancy, but the display is pale and hardly readable at night. 4. The toilet room has a glass door in a metal frame right across from the bed. When one person uses the toilet at night, the light shines right onto the bed. The door slams with a loud bang, no matter how careful you are, because the frame has no padding. 5. There is not a single hook, or a bar, or a rail to hang towels or clothes in the shower room. 6. For two people, there was one tiny bottle of shampoo, and a conditioner of the same size. 7. For storage, there are two tiny drawers. Even the cheapest motels normally have a chest of six! And most of them are CLEAN!!!, too!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Very clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gonzobunni
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews before I chose this hotel. Every review was right on. The hotel was very quiet and clean. The breakfast was amazing. It's not your usually continental breakfast. It's a hot buffet, with choices from eggs, cereal, yogurt,waffles,sausage, bagels, muffins ets. The coffee was pretty good too! I would DEFINATLY stay here again. The staff was friendly too. The room was "spa" like with the colors choosen. Amazing white linens on the bed. Free wi-fi... family stayed at another hotel and had to pay for it! The monorail is across the street at the hilton. Bought a 3 day pass for 28.00! great value for going up and down the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Confused From Gloucester”
Reviews.Author: Confused81
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home today (25th Oct) after 5 nights at this hotel, But we don't agree with the last review ,,,,,,,,,(A great hotel, looking NEW, very comfortable, spotlessly clean, with everything in a room you could think off. Also, great service, attention to customers. Extremely comfortable bed. Good beakfast.),,,,,,,,,,,,, Sorry but me and the wife didn't find this to be so, well not all of it.. (great hotel) wouldn't go that far but ok. (looking NEW, very comfortable, spotlessly clean ) yes but it's only 1yr old..(everything in a room you could think off) No,,There was no inroom safe, diposit box at reception very inconvienent, no dressing gown's, no kettle, had to use warm water and purculate it twice to make tea, no bed side lamps, had to fumble around a bit to find wall switches, (great service, attention to customers) Not bad, reception staff very helpful and polite,didn't see a doorman or a bell boy ,had to carry own bag's up and down to room, (Extremely comfortable bed) they got that one right and nice and BIG.. (Good beakfast) Only if you like scrambled eggs and flat burger type americian sausage's, waffles, bagles and toast.. No other hot food offered all week,, Now our good point's,, Roof top pool, Whow !! wonderfull view's nice and warm, clean and kept tidy.. Reception/house keeping staff very helpful and polite. quiet hotel no gambling, , just right to come back to after the strip..It's location is not that good for getting taxi's, we found ourselves walking 5mins across the road to the Hilton,,,, Would you recommend this hotel to a friend,,, to young families,,, YES!! but to young single/Party go'ers,,, NO!!! Overall this wasnt a bad hotel despite our comments, and this is purely our opinion

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveMN
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 11mo old in a 1 king suite. I picked this hotel due to the fact that it was fairly new, off the strip, had free buffett breakfast, mirowave and frig, and was a suite room. Once I checked in I liked the fact that they where really quick about bring the crib to our room. The room was really spacious I had no problem walking around with the crib in the room. This hotel is set up more for buisiness travelers then it is for families with young children. There is no bathtub only a shower ,the coffee table in the room is tall and splits in half and there was a green vase that was thankfully glued down in the TV stand. This would normally be not a problem but with my 11mo old it was a bit of a challange. The heated pool was a huge plus and the fire pit was really nice. Overall I really liked it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel! (if you don't want to have a casino)”
Reviews.Author: NIGBoston
