Reviews.Content: A great hotel - looking NEW, very comfortable, spotlessly clean, with everything in a room you could think off. Also, great service, attention to customers. Extremely comfortable bed. Good beakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh Addition”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: If you like the latest style of Springhill Suites with its warm, calming colors, water-themed decor, and Euro-style bathrooms featuring bath and wash areas split into two separate rooms, you won't be disappointed. Add the fact that this property is a high-rise with fantastic views (rooms start on the 8th floor), a multi-level parking garage, a rooftop pool & fitness center, and you'll probably forget you're actually staying in a chain Marriott designed to compete with motels. Because Marriotts are completely non-smoking, this entire hotel is free of that stale smoke odor found in most Vegas hotel lobbies. There's a free breakfast served in a giant dining room and a small bar area for drinks and light dinner. You won't need a car to reach the strip; the LV Hilton is across the street (5-10 minute walk) with its own monorail station. Getting to the airport is a snap for the cost- and eco-conscious like me--the 108 bus route stop directly across from the hotel front door will have you there in 15 minutes for only $2!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, brand new property, rooms are fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: niiki9
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long weekend. The hotel is about 2 miles from the strip and away from the hustle and bustle and most of all the traffic that comes with staying at the strip. Rooms were spacious and perfect for 2-3 people. Private desk area, a bath and a 1/2 and the beds are the very comfortable. Big flat screen T.V. in each room. The lobby has a restaurant and computer work area and best of all - a complete hot/cold breakfast better than any restaurant in that area and complimentary as well. I am a travel agent so take it from me - this property is great and I will not hesitate to stay again while visiting Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: azroyalsfan
Reviews.Content: hotel is new and rooms and public areas are very nice for a hotel in this price level. Fitness center is also adequate, although some equipment was broken. Rooftoop pool provides a nice view. Breakfast offereings were good, but the amount of guests overwhelms the buffett line. I would reccomend this hotel if you are specifically wanting to avoid the casinos. If however, you want some activity, I would stay elsewhere, the Las Vegas Hilton is across the street, but in reality takes more effort than that to get to it. You'll be driving or taking transportation to get anywhere from here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and calm”
Reviews.Author: Sky22
Reviews.Content: We went to Las Vegas for a wedding. Liked that there was not a casino or slot machines at this hotel. Liked the modern look of the rooms. Although not on the main strip easy to get to either walking, driving or taking the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Off Strip Hotel With Above and Beyond Service!”
Reviews.Author: Miatt
Reviews.Content: We had made reservations at another hotel on the for Sunday through Tuesday, but decided we would head to Vegas a day early. Being a Saturday night we knew the rates would be higher anywhere on the strip so we chose to book at the Marriott Springhill because it wasn't too hard on the budget. For a one night stay this hotel was AWESOME! We arrived and were surprised to see how close we actually were to the strip (only about a mile maybe 2 mile walk and you are at Encore/Wynn). And if walking is not your thing, cross the street and you can hop right on the monorail and for a small fee you are right on the strip. We walked in to check in and were greeted right away by Marissa at the front desk who was very polite and an awesome front desk agent. She hooked us up with an awesome high floor room with a great view of the strip. She was very nice and made out stay that much better. We got to the room and it was a lot bigger than we expected and very clean. The beds were comfortable and the style was very modern and fun. We had a huge window with awesome views. The bathrooms were clean and spacious and the shower was very nice. Overall this was an awesome hotel with a beautiful location (as far as off the strip goes) and the staff was awesome. Always there to recommend dinner and even remembered us when we came back later that night. It is no wonder almost every guest gives the Springhill a good review!

Reviews.Title: “Great new location - friendly staff, comfortable and stylish facilities.”
Reviews.Author: kerlm
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in Las Vegas, and was booked at this new hotel. It was super! Very modern and clean, very comfortable, great location, great value, and exceedingly nice staff. Breakfast was included with many food choices, and the hotel has a full service bar and restaurant. There is no casino on site, but the strip is close by for casinos and shows. For fans of public transportation, the bus stop within a block of the front door is served by an "express" bus that serves the Strip, as well as a bus that goes direrctly to McCarran Airport. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room- road work at night”
Reviews.Author: silkebg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Springhill Suites in May. We had a big room on the 20th floor with fridge and coffemaker, a little more light in this corner would be helpful. Breakfast buffet was really good (baked goods, make your own waffles, juices, coffee, teas, eggs, different kind of meat each day, yoghurt, fruit). A nice pool is on the rooftop. Friendly staff, free use of computers in the lobby and one especially for printing airline boarding cards for free. Parking is free and secure (entrance with your room card). Guests were mostly business people, so a big difference to a casino hotel,. It is a few minutes walk to the strip, which was no problem for us. We liked that walk more than wandering around the Hilton to find the Monorail. (Besides, we were really disappointed with that ride- to expensive and shaking/rattling making you feel very uncomfortable.) The bad thing-but not the fault of the hotel- road work going on at the front (Paradise Road) and the side of the hotel from 6 to 6 during the night.Front desk told us that this work is going on and off and they can never tell which night. Their tip was to put some of the spare pillows against the window, but this did not help against the noise of course. One more hint: they have these type of sheets that are supposed to be wrinkle free- which they are not. So you might think that the sheets weren´t changed. Front desk insured us, that they were. We liked this hotel much bettter, compared to the MGM, where we stayed at the end of our vacation. We would stay there again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, convenient to Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: swisstravelguru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 4 days at the end of June and found it offered good value for money. My 19th-floor room was clean and spacious, with a comfortable bed and good lighting, and an "office" area with a well-designed desk, comfortable office chair and sofa/coffee table for meetings. The high-speed internet worked well and local phone calls were free. My only complaints are that the single window was streaked with dust from a recent rainstorm and I could hardly see through it (a pity since the view would've been quite good) and that the two little clothes drawers were too small for normal-sized, folded dress shirts. The breakfast buffet was fine but got a bit repetitive on the 4th day. The only fresh fruit offered were apples and bananas, in the middle of the summer. The hotel is right across the street from the Hilton and one block from the Convention Center, where there's a bus stop. There are monorail stops at the Hilton and at the Convention Center; both involve walking about two long blocks in either direction.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review..”
Reviews.Author: sambam68
Reviews.Content: The good: The hotel is very new and all areas appear to be kept very clean. It is smoke-free and is a nice change from the smoggy hotels of the strip. The breakfast buffet is decent. The pool is roof-top and is nice, but closes quite early, especially for Las Vegas. The fitness facility is very nice. The rooms are quite spacious. The bad: Though the rooms are large, there is very little storage. It has a small closet, and 2 very small drawers below the tv. I kept looking around to see if I had missed the dresser, but never found one. The refrigerator and microwave are both quite small and seem to be after thoughts. The upper floors seem to have more noise from the HVAC system than the lower ones do. I was able to drown out the annoying sound with the room a/c fan. My biggest complaint however is the internet. It boasts a "high-speed internet", but currently does not deliver. If you were thinking of this as a place to heavily use a computer (gaming), don't bother. The manager said they already had an upgrade scheduled in a couple of months, but it seems odd to me that a brand new hotel had such an inferior internet backbone. If you're looking for a smoke-free place off the strip and don't care about internet or places for unpacking in your room, then this is your place; otherwise, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not the hotel to choose if easy access to the Strip is what you want”
Reviews.Author: goodrzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first night of a two-week trip to the Southwest. The hotel is easy to reach from the Las Vegas airport if you pay attention to the written directions. The room was very spacious and modern. The only thing that bothered me were the glass shower doors. If you're traveling with children this might be a safety issue. Front desk staff were helpful. The restaurant in the hotel is good. You're pretty far away from the strip and other dining choices. Other reviewers have mentioned the Hilton across the street. The street is actually a very busy highway that didn't look especially inviting to cross, especially since the night we got there the temperature was a record cold.

Reviews.Title: “wedding in vegas”
Reviews.Author: poohandtigger
Reviews.Content: A large number of us came to Vegas for a wedding and birthday celebration. There are only to carts for luggage and found people waiting to use the cart. This hotel is across from the Hilton, which has the transit train. The bus stops directly in front of the hotel. A bus that takes you to the mall stops here as well. The rooms were clean and comfy. Our room slept 6. Which was super. The only problem is the closet is very tiny and couldn't support clothes for 6. Only 2 small drawers. Most everyone kept their clothes in their luggage. Fridge and microwave in the room. Great view from our room, but gorgeous view from the roof. A salt water pool is on the roof. No hot tub. My husband used the excerise room and said it was great. Breakfast was fabulous, with waffles, eggs, fruit, oatmeal, and bagels. This hotel is 2 blocks off the strip and is very quiet. There is secured parking and I felt safe all around. It was nice not to have a casino or slots in the hotel. I've stayed other places on the strip and preferred being just off. We drove our car down the back side of the strip to get around. We had no problems finding parking spots at other casinos where our ativities were being held. Only problem the internet was only available in the lobby. Which was full.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent non-gaming choice”
Reviews.Author: Liz1953
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at this new hotel. Others have correctly reviewed it. When we couldn't figure out the air conditioner, someone immediately came up to show us. Very nice, helpful stafff. The pool was small, but quiet and nice. We would definitely stay here again if we weren't seeking the action of the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again without any questions”
Reviews.Author: cdleps
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my husband and 13 month old son while we were on a very last minute road trip. I made the reservations two days before we arrived and was told to call the morning of to see if we would be able to check in early. I spoke with Lynn around 10am and told her we would be there before 1pm. When we arrived she saw me enter the lobby with my son and had already pulled our reservation and had our room ready.....I think it was 17422? But it was a great room in the back corner, nice and quiet so we would not be disturbed, nor disturb others when and if my son had a screaming fit! The room was clean, though no bathtub (the only problem I had with the room) so my son had his first shower. (It did not go well!) The hotel has only been open since October 2009, so the room was still new and fresh. The carpet was a bit dirty (which I only noticed when I took my son's socks off and saw they were very dark grey (and had been white.) Otherwise the room was perfect. Very comfortable bed and after moving the small table by the couch or travel pop-up crib fit perfectly and we had plenty of room still to move around. The breakfast buffet in the morning was great! The coffee a bit weak, but all else was good! The service at the lobby was excellent (thank you SO much Lynn) and the restaraunt staff was quick with cleaning off tables and very friendly. The hotel is non-smoking and had free on-site parking. The hotel is geared more for business traveler's, but we saw several other families. It was great to be in a hotel off-strip and totally non-smoking. The refrigerator and microwave in the room was a big plus for my son's snacks and dinner! The pool on the roof was nice, small and heated. It was my son's first time in the pool, so we did not stay long, but it would be great to relax there with out him next time. I will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Few Issues”
Reviews.Author: biztraveler22
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at this hotel. All the kudo's everyone is giving this property are true. It is located across the street from the Hilton at the convention center. While this property doesn't have the glamor of a Bellagio or Wynn, it also doesn't have the crowds or noise. Check-in is quick, rooms are comfortable and large. The rooftop pool is small and quiet with about 24 lounge chairs. Bring your own food and drink to the pool cause there aren't any wait staff walking around to take orders. You get a different crowd in a non-smoking, non-gaming property. In my opinion, a much better crowd. There is a gas station and convenience store next door to purchase snacks, drinks, beer, etc. Breakfast is the typical free buffet breakfast. Nothing spectacular but it will do. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The fitness center was more than expected. There is a business center with 3 computers next to the check in desk. The Downside: It is next to impossible to get a cab at this hotel. You have to cross the street to the Hilton for a cab. There is a serious lack of restaurnants in this area. You can go across the street to the Hilton or head to the strip. If you decide to head out to the strip (meaning the area of the Wynn down to Mandalay Bay) you can take the monorail or a cab which are both located - you guessed it - across the street at the Hilton. I love to walk but walking to the strip from here is not worth it. It can be done, but there isn't any scenery until you hit the Wynn. If you don't mind a few inconveniences, this property is beautiful, well kept and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent off strip property next to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Drizz1129
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay at this great new property and can't wait to go back! The new springhill suites rooms are wonderful... fresh, modern, comfortable, and they seem so much larger!! The location is perfect if you are going to the convention center... it's right across the street! If you are looking to be right on the strip, this place probably isnt for you. It is behind the Riviera and kinda far from the action on the strip. But its easy to get in and out if you have a car. The hotel is directly accros from that GIANT hilton sign on Paradise. The free breakfast was great, and they even have a bar and restaurant in the lobby, something I have never seen before at a springhill suites property. The roof top salt water pool is AMAZING. It is quite small so if there are a lot of people there you may be annoyed, but it is a great escape from the normal overcroweded mega pools of most resorts. They have a cozy firepit on the roof as well which is perfect to relax at after a long day walking the strip. We spent every evening there! They have a 24 hour gym too with great equipment and big TVs. Perfect for a quick workout. There was a business center in the lobby as well with really cool touch screen computers! And they were free to use and to print from. Amazing!! Our room was very comfortable and quiet. It also took 20 seconds to walk from the elevator to your room, unlike the mazes found at some strip hotels. The rooms had a fridge and microwave and giant flat screen tvs. My only complaint is the parking garage. And really it was not a big deal. The garage is the first 8 floors of the hotel, so you park, then have to take an elevator down to the lobby, walk through the lobby, then take another set of elevators to your room. Like I said, no big deal, but it was annoying if you were in a hurry or forgot something in your room. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff was friendly, the place is brand new and looks great, and the location was fine for our needs. Check out their website to see the rooms, they all look that good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Great price! Quiet place to sleep while in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: McDowB
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the hotel April 21st through April 25th. Everything was exceptional. From the time that I entered the lobby to the time I checked out, the service was first class! The room was very clean. There was a mini refrig and microwave in the room. This was a business and leisure trip combined. I would highly recommend this hotel to individuals who want to be able to sleep while in Las Vegas! It is located directly across the street from the Las Vegas Hilton so if gambling is your thing, it is readily available! No taxi needed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for off-Strip accommodation”
Reviews.Author: saybrook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Spring Hill Suites. The building just recently opened, is well appointed, room are spacious with separate sleeping area and sitting area, separate bathroom/shower and toilet. Room are well furnished, modern and very comfortable (as in all Marriotts, their beds are great) Staff and check in were very uneventfull and very friendly. There is a small heated pool in the roofdeck, as well as a fire pit. Breakfast is included with the room rates and, unlike some reports of other travellers, it was always stocked and replenished - everything from eggs, wafles, fresh fruite, bagels, pastries, juices, yoghurt, etc - an excellent breakfast buffet. Breakfast is served in the very spacious and airy lobby. We had a rental car - there is a parking garage on the lower floors of the building (parking is free). Drive from the hotel to the Strip is a few minutes (parking at hotels on the Strip such as Bellagio, Venetian is free). Walking from Springhill Suites is also an option - we walked several times, but are avid walkers (so this wasn't a problem) - a leisurely walk is about 10 - 15 min to the Strip. The metro train station is across the street by the Hilton - we never used it. Hotel has computers in the lobby to access your email and print boarding passes. Apart from eating breakfast there, we did not sample the food or the bar. It is not an upscale luxury hotel - we knew that - but an incredibly good value, since we did not want to stay right on the strip. Would definitely stay there again and can recommend in best conscience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for convention stay, not so convenient for leisure.”
Reviews.Author: GottaLuvCruising
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Springhill Suites Las Vegas (by the convention center) after our vacation on the strip. We were looking for a nice room to relax before our flight home and this fit the bill. The new hotel is lovely. Our king bed room was very comfortable and well designed. The cool blue / greens and Asian-influenced decor came together nicely with a very fresh appearance. The pocket doors to the split bath suited the decor perfectly and were a great space-saving design. We found the parking garage inconvenient as you have to exit the hotel lobby to enter a separate elevator to the garage. It was also annoying to need the room key with every use of the elevator and to enter the parking garage, pool, fitness center and guest laundry. I understand the security aspect, but felt this was a bit much. For its intended purpose (convention center business) the location is perfect and the hotel is awesome. For our restful night, it was fine. But for a Las Vegas tourist, I'd rather be closer to the action. The heated roof top pool was small, but very nice. And I would love to have had time to sit by the fire pit. The free internet access was great (after paying $20 per day for it at Treasure Island all week). Breakfast was pretty good. Scrambled eggs and turkey sausage were the only protein options. There was a nice variety of other items (breads, cereals, waffles, yogurt, apples, juices) and everything was presented well. Dining area was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not convenient to Strip”
Reviews.Author: proudftd
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I like the Marriott chain, and I was staying for 4 nights and wanted a reasonably priced suite. The hotel is fairly new, so I thought it would be a good choice. However, I was a bit disappointed. Their on-site "restaurant" was more of a lounge, and focused more on drinks than food. I did eat their twice during my stay, and one of those times I did not receive what I ordered. The room was never quite as clean as I like, and the front desk staff didn't seem very knowledgable about the area. Compared to other hotels, it was a bit overpriced. Breakfast options were many, thought they repeated their hot foods every other day. Also, although the hotel is across the street from the tram which takes you to the Strip, it is a 5-minute walk through the Hilton to get to the tram, and then a 5-minute walk through other hotels at the other end to get to the Strip. The alternatives are taxi (I paid various prices depending on the honesty of the drivers), or walking (quite a hike and not recommended).

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas stay”
Reviews.Author: toiyabe
Reviews.Content: Hotel had just opened, so the facility and staff was going through growing pains. Even with that, the facility is outstanding. The staff went out of their way to see that our meeting needs were met. Great location to both the old and new stripes.
